intro: Hedysarum wakhanicum, commonly known as the Wakhan milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh climates. Hedysarum wakhanicum plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for livestock in its native habitat. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in alpine ecosystems.
